Description: NEOMA Business School is a respected higher education institution in France, offering a wide range of academic programs and research activities. The institution provides undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral-level study options across multiple disciplines. Academic staff at NEOMA Business School combine teaching and research, contributing to regional and international scholarship. NEOMA Business School places emphasis on student-centred learning, practical skills and employability to prepare graduates for professional careers. Research centers and collaborative projects at NEOMA Business School tackle contemporary challenges in science, technology, arts and society. The campus environment supports a diverse student population, including international students, through exchange and mobility programs. NEOMA Business School maintains partnerships with industry and other universities to offer internships, joint research and career pathways. Through its academic programs and community engagement, NEOMA Business School aims to foster innovation and leadership among its graduates.
Facilities: Modern lecture halls and seminar rooms; Comprehensive digital and physical libraries; Research laboratories and specialized technical facilities; Student support services (counselling, international office, career services); On-campus or nearby student accommodation options; Cafeterias and dining facilities; Sports and recreation facilities; Student clubs and cultural activities; Career centres, incubators and industry collaboration spaces

The institution provides undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral-level study options across multiple disciplines. Academic staff at Le Cordon Bleu combine teaching and research, contributing to regional and international scholarship. Le Cordon Bleu places emphasis on student-centred learning, practical skills and employability to prepare graduates for professional careers. Research centers and collaborative projects at Le Cordon Bleu tackle contemporary challenges in science, technology, arts and society. The campus environment supports a diverse student population, including international students, through exchange and mobility programs. Le Cordon Bleu maintains partnerships with industry and other universities to offer internships, joint research and career pathways. Through its academic programs and community engagement, Le Cordon Bleu aims to foster innovation and leadership among its graduates.
Facilities: Modern lecture halls and seminar rooms; Comprehensive digital and physical libraries; Research laboratories and specialized technical facilities; Student support services (counselling, international office, career services); On-campus or nearby student accommodation options; Cafeterias and dining facilities; Sports and recreation facilities; Student clubs and cultural activities
